memberdef.argsstring: (cache_entry_t *pentry_parent, fsal_name_t *pname, fsal_attrib_list_t *pattr, hash_table_t *ht, cache_inode_client_t *pclient, fsal_op_context_t *pcontext, cache_inode_status_t *pstatus, int use_mutex)
memberdef.name: cache_inode_lookup_sw

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_lookup_sw: looks up for a name in a directory indicated by a cached entry.
Looks up for a name in a directory indicated by a cached entry. The directory should have been cached before.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] entry for the parent directory to be managed.
[IN] name of the entry that we are looking for in the cache.
[OUT] attributes for the entry that we have found.
[IN] hash table used for the cache, unused in this call.
[INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
[IN] FSAL credentials
[OUT] returned status.
[IN] if TRUE, mutex management is done, not if equal to FALSE.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry

memberdef.argsstring: (cache_entry_t *pentry_parent, fsal_name_t *pname, fsal_attrib_list_t *pattr, hash_table_t *ht, cache_inode_client_t *pclient, fsal_op_context_t *pcontext, cache_inode_status_t *pstatus)
memberdef.name: cache_inode_lookup_no_mutex

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_lookup_no_mutex: looks up for a name in a directory indicated by a cached entry (no mutex management).

Looks up for a name in a directory indicated by a cached entry. The directory should have been cached before. This function has no mutex management and suppose that is it properly done in the clling function

parameterdescription.para: [IN] entry for the parent directory to be managed.
[IN] name of the entry that we are looking for in the cache.
[OUT] attributes for the entry that we have found.
[IN] hash table used for the cache, unused in this call.
[INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
[IN] FSAL credentials
[OUT] returned status.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry

memberdef.name: cache_inode_lookup

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_lookup: looks up for a name in a directory indicated by a cached entry.
Looks up for a name in a directory indicated by a cached entry. The directory should have been cached before.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] entry for the parent directory to be managed.
[IN] name of the entry that we are looking for in the cache.
[OUT] attributes for the entry that we have found.
[IN] hash table used for the cache, unused in this call.
[INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
[IN] FSAL credentials
[OUT] returned status.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry
